posts.author: lightningkmf
posts.content: Could anyone assist with making an Arcane Archer on Arelith? The only change that most are not familiar with my now is that you can take Ranger lvls instead of arcane lvls to become an AA. I am not sure if that would even be preferable.

posts.author: RookY2K
posts.content:
If you want to get useful (and maybe even actual) replies to this request, I highly suggest reading this: Build request guidelines.

From my relatively limited experience with the guild members, they are very willing to help tweak or even help you build a toon from scratch, but they cannot do so without a little more insight into what you want. I have zero experience playing Arcane Archers, but I imagine there are a range (no pun intended) of ways to play them. Give us a little more to go on after you read the post I linked above and I guarantee that you will get better responses.

posts.author: Atypical
posts.content:
Race? Are you thinking Elf, or maybe Drow?

Character background? RP is important on Arelith, and you can't take Paragon Classes without requesting it of the DM's--meaning you may have difficulty taking one at low levels when you character isn't established. Good luck convincing a DM that your new level 3 Ranger is TOTALLY an arcane archer.

Something to work with, at least.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
Arcane archer prestige class Requirements:
Base Attack Bonus: +6
Feats: Weapon Focus (Longbow or Shortbow), Point Blank Shot
Race: Elf or Half-elf
Spellcasting: Ability to cast arcane spells ( Bard, Sorcerer, Wizard) or Ranger

Any changes to this other than the added ranger class as an alternative to spellcaster?
Is GMW modified to work on ranged weapons?
What is the best mighty property you can get on the bows there? What items/gear can you get to boost strength? That is important for how much strenght you want.

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
Arcane Archers straight up isn't really rocket science, unless you want some Divine Might with it, some melee presence or something special like that.

Lvl split would be Fighter/wizard/AA19. Simple as that. Wizard can be Bard, which might be a lot better. Lvl split with the normal classes I guess whatever works.

Paladin/Sorc/AA19 for Divine mighter

HiPS was disabled right? Shadow Archers are otherwise fun.

HiPS was disabled right? Shadow Archers are otherwise fun.
Better to take Ranger instead of Wiz? Better HP, AB and bonus feats.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: How many Ranger lvls are needed to qualify?

posts.author: Atypical
posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:How many Ranger lvls are needed to qualify?
Ranger class removes the Arcane Magic requirement entirely; once you've taken the prerequisite 3 levels in Ranger that the server dictates for any new class, you're free to take AA. Ranger 3/ AA 1 works, if you can convince the DM's to let you take it that early.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Atypical wrote:
KailPendragon wrote:How many Ranger lvls are needed to qualify?
Ranger class removes the Arcane Magic requirement entirely; once you've taken the prerequisite 3 levels in Ranger that the server dictates for any new class, you're free to take AA. Ranger 3/ AA 1 works, if you can convince the DM's to let you take it that early.
Ranger 21/AA 9 then? BoE and +5 enchant arrow will make a solid damage deliverer and one can spend a good amount of levels as Ranger (up to 21) to prepare the way to AA.

posts.author: lightningkmf
posts.content:
Thank you all for your quick replies and I apologize for my lack of information. I was wanting this build to do well in pvp and pve. The level cap is 30 and I was thinking elf for my race though if half elf is preferable I can do that as well. The best bow one can get is +3ab,+ 2d6 massive critical, 2 mighty and the highest craft-able arrows add +3 piercing damage. Someone correct me if this is not the case but I also believe there are +1d6 +1d6 arrows you could get and then add a final 1d4 in the enchanting basin

I had thought of a few lvl combinations but was unable to decide which would be better or should be used. Would anyone be willing to say the pros and cons of these:

16 bard
5 ftr
9 AA

21 Ranger
9 AA

? Ftr
? Wiz
19 AA

Thank you in advance for your help.

posts.author: Atypical
posts.content:
lightningkmf wrote:Thank you all for your quick replies and I apologize for my lack of information. I was wanting this build to do well in pvp and pve. The level cap is 30 and I was thinking elf for my race though if half elf is preferable I can do that as well. The best bow one can get is +3ab,+ 2d6 massive critical, 2 mighty and the highest craft-able arrows add +3 piercing damage. Someone correct me if this is not the case but I also believe there are +1d6 +1d6 arrows you could get and then add a final 1d4 in the enchanting basin

I had thought of a few lvl combinations but was unable to decide which would be better or should be used. Would anyone be willing to say the pros and cons of these:

16 bard
5 ftr
9 AA

21 Ranger
9 AA

? Ftr
? Wiz
19 AA

Thank you in advance for your help.
Gotta walk the dog, so just a few quick notes

-The more ranks in AA, the more bonus damage you get. Similarly, the more Ranger levels, the more Favoured Enemies you get. Bard gives better Bardsong the more you level it. So any combination involving any of them will want to maximize them, because you get better the more you have.

-Fighter and WIzard are a different story. Since you won't be focusing on Wiz levels, you'll have crappy spells. So you'd end up taking 3 levels in Wiz for basically nothing. And Fighter works best as a minor class, IMO. Once you hit level 4 and take Weapon Spec, you should look elsewhere.

-From your list of options, then, I'd recommend the first or second.

posts.author: lightningkmf
posts.content: Another option that I did not mention could be to go heavy rogue with some AA. I am not sure how well that could do though.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Atypical wrote:

Gotta walk the dog, so just a few quick notes

-The more ranks in AA, the more bonus damage you get.
And even more importantly, the more AB you get: +1 AB/2 AA lvls. That's just huge.
Similarly, the more Ranger levels, the more Favoured Enemies you get. Bard gives better Bardsong the more you level it.
Aye, but Bard has its own first stopping point at lvl 16 for a mature bard song. Ranger is more demanding since one usually will want to get BoE which adds AB and damage vs FEs and which requires 21+ lvls. Also, Bard can definitely be used as a dump class granting access to AA, since it has both tumble and UMD, not to mention taunt.
So any combination involving any of them will want to maximize them, because you get better the more you have.

-Fighter and WIzard are a different story. Since you won't be focusing on Wiz levels, you'll have crappy spells. So you'd end up taking 3 levels in Wiz for basically nothing. And Fighter works best as a minor class, IMO. Once you hit level 4 and take Weapon Spec, you should look elsewhere.

-From your list of options, then, I'd recommend the first or second.
FTR 6/Bard 6/AA 18? Something like the thing below, which surely needs to be optimized since it was thrown together in 5 minutes:


Fighter(6), Bard(6), Arcane Archer(18)
Elf

STR: 14
DEX: 18 (26)
CON: 13 (14)
WIS: 8
INT: 14
CHA: 8

Hitpoints: 330
Skillpoints: 180
Saving Throws (Fortitude/Will/Reflex): 23/12/25
Saving Throw bonuses: Mind Effects: +2
BAB: 23
AB (max, naked): 26 (melee), 44 (ranged)
AC (naked/mundane armor/shield only): 26/30

Hide 33(41), Move Silently 33(41), Perform 13(12), Taunt 33(32), Tumble 30(38), UMD 31(30), remaining skillpoints 7

Elf: (Hardiness vs. Enchantments, Keen Sense, Low-light Vision, Skill Affinity: Listen, Skill Affinity: Search, Skill Affinity: Spot, Sleeplessness)
01: Fighter(1): Point Blank Shot, Rapid Shot
02: Fighter(2): Weapon Focus: Longbow
03: Fighter(3): Blind Fight
04: Bard(1): CON+1, (CON=14) this level only has a 20% XP penalty
05: Bard(2)
06: Bard(3): Called Shot
07: Fighter(4): Weapon Specialization: Longbow
08: Arcane Archer(1): DEX+1, (DEX=19)
09: Arcane Archer(2): Toughness
10: Arcane Archer(3)
11: Arcane Archer(4)
12: Arcane Archer(5): DEX+1, Dodge, (DEX=20)
13: Bard(4)
14: Arcane Archer(6)
15: Arcane Archer(7): Mobility
16: Arcane Archer(8): DEX+1, (DEX=21)
17: Arcane Archer(9)
18: Bard(5): Improved Critical: Longbow
19: Fighter(5)
20: Arcane Archer(10): DEX+1, (DEX=22)
21: Arcane Archer(11): Epic Weapon Focus: Longbow
22: Arcane Archer(12)
23: Arcane Archer(13)
24: Fighter(6): DEX+1, Great Dexterity I, Epic Weapon Specialization: Longbow, (DEX=24)
25: Arcane Archer(14): Epic Prowess
26: Arcane Archer(15)
27: Arcane Archer(16): Epic Fortitude
28: Arcane Archer(17): DEX+1, (DEX=25)
29: Arcane Archer(18): Great Dexterity II, (DEX=26)
30: Bard(6): Armor Skin

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
lightningkmf wrote:Another option that I did not mention could be to go heavy rogue with some AA. I am not sure how well that could do though.
Rogue 13/Wiz 3/AA 14 epic dodger. Pity for the 3 lvls in a row requirement, it will cost -1AB (because of wiz).

posts.author: Grimnir
posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:Rogue 13/Wiz 3/AA 14 epic dodger. Pity for the 3 lvls in a row requirement, it will cost -1AB (because of wiz).
Ranger? Bard? to preserve AB.

I wouldn't go 21Ranger/9AA.

Seeing as fighter4/AA19 alone trumps the AB and almost equals the damage. BoE will give you 7-17 extra damage vs SELECTED enemies.
EWS+ 5 extra Enchanted arrows gives +11. That's just a point behind. In additon you can take alittle more fighter and top it off with bard to get his tumble and song.

That said, ranger has advantages other than BoE. Skillpoints, like trapping skills, which can be really good in archer builds. Spells that help stealth. The fighter build (Say fighter6/bard5/AA19) starts to come into it's own way before a DEX-base Bane Ranger.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Grimnir wrote:
KailPendragon wrote:Rogue 13/Wiz 3/AA 14 epic dodger. Pity for the 3 lvls in a row requirement, it will cost -1AB (because of wiz).
Ranger? Bard? to preserve AB.
Aye, I was trying not to give him an XP penalty and use elf. Ranger and half elf would avoid having to spen a feat on martial weapons and also avoids a further BAB loss from Bard 1.
I wouldn't go 21Ranger/9AA.

Seeing as fighter4/AA19 alone trumps the AB and almost equals the damage. BoE will give you 7-17 extra damage vs SELECTED enemies.
EWS+ 5 extra Enchanted arrows gives +11. That's just a point behind. In additon you can take alittle more fighter and top it off with bard to get his tumble and song.

That said, ranger has advantages other than BoE. Skillpoints, like trapping skills, which can be really good in archer builds. Spells that help stealth. The fighter build (Say fighter6/bard5/AA19) starts to come into it's own way before a DEX-base Bane Ranger.
Ranger's BoE also grants +2 AB vs selected enemies, but aye it will lag behind AB wise (and hence also damage output wise) because of the extra AA levels. Still it would be not a bad build with a DW option for melee, some decent spells (helping stealth too), stealth and trap skills.

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
So let me get this straight. You can bypass the arcane requirement entirely with 3 levels of ranger but still be subject to the elf/half-elf race prereq?

How about a zen Ranger(3), Arcane Archer(12), Cleric(15), Elf, STR 8 DEX 16 CON 14 WIS 16 (26) INT 12 CHA 8? Unbuffed AB about 40 @lvl30 with self-buffing divine/magical irresistable damage. Let DP supply the mighty damage if you find a bow with that prop. A pure dexer AA will always beat a zen archer with the Grt Dex feats available in epic but won't touch the cleric buff damage. You can probably pump another AB by dropping the initial DEX but I left it there for AC and reflex, not that any artillery archer needs much AC (or HPs for that matter). Or perhaps drop 2 AA (& the -1AB, of course) for cleric 9 spells. Your choice.

posts.author: lightningkmf
posts.content:
HipMaestro wrote:So let me get this straight. You can bypass the arcane requirement entirely with 3 levels of ranger but still be subject to the elf/half-elf race prereq?
That is correct. I should also note that there are different sub races of elf that one can choose.
The other options are as follows.

Moon Elves
+2 DEX, -2 CON
Moon elves get no different bonuses than the default elven ones.

Sun Elves

INT +2, CON -2
Favored Class: Wizard

Wild Elves

DEX +2, INT -2
Favored Class: Sorcerer

Wood Elves

STR +2, DEX +2, CON -2, INT -2, CHA -2
Favored Class: Ranger

posts.author: conlaoch
posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:
lightningkmf wrote:Another option that I did not mention could be to go heavy rogue with some AA. I am not sure how well that could do though.
Rogue 13/Wiz 3/AA 14 epic dodger. Pity for the 3 lvls in a row requirement, it will cost -1AB (because of wiz).
I'm assuming the Rogue 13 was for Epic Dodge...

It may cost 1 AB, but to be honest, I'd be willing to lose 2 more AA levels to get at least to wiz 5.

Why Wiz 5? Craft wand.

I can see wands of
Flame weapon
Cat's grace
Bull Strength
Ghostly Visage
Invis
Haste
Greater Magic Weapon
Displacement


That leaves Stinking cloud and web to slow em down while you shoot them. Two more levels of AA loss (for a total of -2 AB altogether) would also net you Improved Invisibility, Isaacs Lesser Missile Storm, Elemental Shield, Stoneskin, Icestorm.


Conlaoch

posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
lightningkmf wrote:I should also note that there are different sub races of elf that one can choose. The other options are as follows.

Moon Elves
+2 DEX, -2 CON
Moon elves get no different bonuses than the default elven ones.

Sun Elves
INT +2, CON -2
Favored Class: Wizard

Wild Elves
DEX +2, INT -2
Favored Class: Sorcerer

Wood Elves
STR +2, DEX +2, CON -2, INT -2, CHA -2
Favored Class: Ranger
Since apparently XP pen is not a significant issue, none seem to benefit a zen archer any better than the standard elf bias. Unless this was intended as a PBS archer, in which case, you'll need to stick to high DEX and perhaps even ED and use Wild Elf since archer skill set can be relatively lean. IMO archers naturally suck at bow melee being subject to KD, Called Shots & Disarm quite easily but that is a personal style decision.

posts.author: Demos
posts.content: How about a Ranger 10 / AA 14 / Rogue 6 with Ranger 9 / AA 8 / Rogue 3 pre-epic to get an almost max BAB. Ranger 10 in epic lets you grab Epic Prowess and spread the remaining 3 Rogue levels for Tumble dumps. I know you plan to fight from afar but if mobs manage to reach you, you'll have dual wielding (assuming light/no armor - you're going DEX here) and Uncanny Dodge. Not to mention Evasion if enemy mages decide to use you for target practice of their own. If you're in a group then hopefully your tanks can keep them off you but sometimes *stuff* just happens.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Demos wrote:How about a Ranger 10 / AA 14 / Rogue 6 with Ranger 9 / AA 8 / Rogue 3 pre-epic to get an almost max BAB. Ranger 10 in epic lets you grab Epic Prowess and spread the remaining 3 Rogue levels for Tumble dumps. I know you plan to fight from afar but if mobs manage to reach you, you'll have dual wielding (assuming light/no armor - you're going DEX here) and Uncanny Dodge. Not to mention Evasion if enemy mages decide to use you for target practice of their own. If you're in a group then hopefully your tanks can keep them off you but sometimes *stuff* just happens.
In that case I'd suggest Ranger 10 AA 15 Rogue 5 for +1 AB, as AA gains +1 AB every odd level and Rogue 6 gives you nothing except skill points
